HOT LUXURY DEAL

fields.title: Regent road apartments
fields.content:
Pavilion Wharf comprises one, two and three-bedroom contemporary apartments designed to the highest standard to provide residents with luxury waterside living.

Pavilion Wharf offers a comprehensive suite of on-site amenities to allow residents to enjoy a twenty-first-century city lifestyle to the full.
A gymnasium, residents’ lounge, co-working space, concierge services, a dedicated post room, secure car parking, and cycle storage provide the reward for living in one of the UK’s most dynamic cities.
This high-specification 17-storey building, complemented with Juliette balconies and a communal garden terrace, comprises 160 stunning waterside apartments with impressive city and water views.

To indulge in quieter moments, residents benefit from an additional garden terrace to relax, overlooking the river and enjoying their own private outside space away from the bustle of modern city life.
An excellent range of local shops, bars and restaurants can be found within walking distance or an easy bike ride.

The elegant, contemporary design references the mill buildings that once occupied the site. Pavilion Wharf has a mature, sophisticated and considered appearance with a hint of Chicago. An elevated resident’s terrace makes the most of its riverside setting, whilst significant public realm improvements will transform the area into a destination.

The ideal purchase for investors or first-time buyers, this stunning modern brand-new development is a classic example of contemporary living!

AREA

BORDER OF SALFORD AND MANCHESTER - As well as enjoying everything that Manchester has to offer, the enviable riverside location of Pavilion
Wharf gives excellent access to the historic Castlefield area and is also close to Manchester city
centre, unlocking the full potential that city living has to offer for residents.
Also, just a stone’s throw away is Salford Quays and MediaCityUK. MediaCityUK is Manchester’s new waterfront destination, with digital creativity, learning and leisure at its heart and home to the BBC and ITV.
Manchester is a buy-to-let hotspot with international recognition as many young people flock to the city, increasing property prices and demand for luxury apartments.
Manchester has excellent rail connections, with three major train stations in the city centre. London is just two hours away. The new high-speed railway, HS2, will ensure great links to the capital and halve the journey time.

fields.content:
NO INVESTORS
This is a unique opportunity like no other. Walking through Manchester, you will fail to see a building like this, housing apartments so high in specification or so rich in a lifetime investment.
This incredible 200-year-old Mill has been restored into awesome loft-apartments. Each apartment boasts beautiful high ceilings, huge windows, and exposed brick and timber beams.
Picadilly East apartments ooze industrial character, with exposed bricks, timber beams, high ceilings and huge windows that soak the apartments in light.

fields.title: The one – london – woolwich
fields.content:
The WOOLWICH Apartments offer a
style of living that is rare to find in London. Surrounding the development is heritage in abundance,
a legacy of listed buildings, a fascinating melting pot of
cultures and the capital’s best transport connections.
All wrapped up in a riverside location and offered at a
price point that is affordable for the capital city.

Choose from one of 19 elegantly-designed
one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments
and revel in a superior standard of living and
first-class specification – where private outside
space in the form of a recessed balcony or
terrace is as standard, and comfortable luxury
is the default setting. Enjoy far-reaching views of London’s skyline from your balcony.

The WOOLWICH Apartments allow you to live today’s
preferred lifestyle, thanks to open plan living
areas, full-height glazing, integrated Bosch
appliances, sleek fitte kitchen and hotel-inspired bathrooms.

There is a lift access to all floors,
a pet-friendly ethos, a secure entrance, a
number of biodiverse roofs, photo voltaic
panels, renewable energy/low carbon
technologies throughout and a wildlifewelcoming communal terrace..

AREA

The town, which is now a part of the larger Docklands regeneration region, is the most interesting place in South East London. It is vibrant, diversified, and on the cutting edge of change.
Due to the number of desirable recreational, shopping, and social options in this area, moving here will allow you to experience the essence of metropolitan living. Several times a week, there is a vibrant street market in Beresford Square.

The area around the property is rich in historical, leaving behind a legacy of listed buildings, a unique mingling of cultures, and the greatest transportation options in the city. All of this is provided in a riverbank setting at a cost that is reasonable for the nation's capital.

A well-established High Street and two revitalised public spaces, General Gordon Square and Beresford Square, which allow access to green, open space afforded by Woolwich Common, Charlton Park, Blackheath Common, and Greenwich Park, complete the town's historic district.
The Punchdrunk performance theatre, the National Youth Jazz Orchestra, Chineke!, and other resident and travelling artistic organisations now call Woolwich Works, a brand-new cultural centre, café, and bar, home.

With a High Street crammed with well-known retail chains and niche stores, Woolwich is also well supplied by large supermarkets and specialty shops.

Closest station is Woolwich DLR which is a 5 minute walk away.
7 mins to Canary Wharf
5 mins to London city airport
